g.text: Zhang et al. Microbiological Methods in Oil Spill Studies
pure culture and classical molecular biological methods (e.g.,
Clone Library, TRFLP, TGGE/DGGE, and RT-qPCR), provide
qualitative impressions about the functional bacteria conducting
and single-cell sequencing) have also generated a great amount
data on bacterial composition and predicted potential pathways
for hydrocarbon degradation. For future investigation, we
recommend an informed application of prevalent NGS-based
genomic technologies and microbial network reconstruction in
Especially, integrated application of diﬀerent approaches
could aﬀord a more comprehensive view of indigenous
bacterial communities and their potential functions in polluted
SZ, ZH, and HW provided substantial contributions to the
conception and design of the work. SZ and HW drafted the
work. SZ, ZH and HWagree to be accountable for all aspects of
the work in ensuring that questions related to the accuracy or
integrity of any part of the work are appropriately investigated
Funding for this study was provided by National Natural Science

Distinguished Scholars (HW)] and the Department of Education
